text: María Asunción Balaguer Golobart (8 November 1925 – 23 November 2019) was a Spanish actress. She appeared in more than 100 movies and television shows from 1952 to 2016. In 1983, she played El barón, by Leandro Fernández de Moratín. In 1984, she played La cena del rey Baltasar, by Pedro Calderón de la Barca. Her best known roles include: El canto del gallo, The Witching Hour and The Bird of Happiness. Balaguer died on 23 November 2019 in Madrid of multiple organ failure caused by a stroke, aged 94. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1925 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Deaths from stroke Category:Deaths from multiple organ failure Category:Spanish movie actors Category:Spanish television actors Category:Actors from Madrid
title: Asunción Balaguer
